title: Duke and Duchess of Cambridge meet puppies training to find IEDs in rescheduled last day of Pakistan tour
text:
The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have been compelled to reschedule the last day of their Pakistan tour after their plane got caught in a thunderstorm.

The Duke and Duchess were due to fly over the Khyber Pass in an engagement focused on international security on Friday, but a "pretty bad storm" saw their flight from Lahore to Islamabad turn back on Thursday evening.

The couple stayed at the Pearl Continental Hotel in the capital of Punjab overnight following two aborted landings by the RAF Voyager pilot.

Strikes of lightning could be seen from the carrier plane near the right wing as it shook with heavy turbulence.

The Duke, who went to check on travelling media, made a reference to his time as an air ambulance pilot, joking: "I was flying!"

One passenger said it was a "pretty serious storm", describing the flight as a "rollercoaster".
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have been compelled to reschedule the last day of their Pakistan tour after their plane got caught in a thunderstorm.
